Weâ€™d like to know more about how you manage your pain and what has worked for you. When answering these questions, please focus on pain related to what brings you in for your upcoming medical visit.

These treatments are organized into sections by type:
Basic therapies
Mind-body therapies
New therapies
Non-prescription medicines
Prescription medicines

code.display: What have you tried in the past 6 months to help you with your pain? Select all answers that apply. We also want to know if it worked for you.

item.text: What have you tried in the past 6 months to help you with your pain? Select all answers that apply. We also want to know if it worked for you.

item.prefix: Exercises at home (such as those assigned by a therapist) or outside (such as walking, jogging, swimming)
Sleep positioners or devices (such as additional pillows, padding, etc.)
Weight loss or changes in your diet

code.display: Have you used any of the following items you can buy without a prescription from your doctor to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.text: Have you used any of the following items you can buy without a prescription from your doctor to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.prefix: Pain relievers (such as Advil, Aleve, Aspirin, Ibuprofen, Motrin, Tylenol)
Herbal or nutritional pain relievers (such as ginseng or kava kava)
Cremes, lotions, gels or patches applied to the skin (for example BENGAYÂ®, TIGER BALMÂ® or BiOFREEZEÂ®)

code.display: Have you used any of the following prescription medications to help with your pain in the last 6 months?

item.text: Have you used any of the following prescription medications to help with your pain in the last 6 months?

item.prefix: Opioid medications (such as hydrocodone, oxycodone, codeine, morphine and fentanyl)
Procedure or Injection (such as a shot to relieve inflammation)
Non-opioid medications as prescribed by a doctor (such as Celebrex or Cymbalta)

code.display: Have you tried any of the following new therapies to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.text: Have you tried any of the following new therapies to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.prefix: Group or individual therapy for pain
Sleep management (such as a sleep study or CPAP)

code.display: Have you tried any of the following new therapies to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.text: Have you tried any of the following new therapies to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

code.display: Weâ€™d like to know more about you and your goals. What are your most important activity goals? For example: Iâ€™d like to be able to walk without pain.

item.text: Weâ€™d like to know more about you and your goals. What are your most important activity goals? For example: Iâ€™d like to be able to walk without pain.

code.display: What are the biggest barriers to achieving your activity goals? For example: I have a lot of stress from work which makes my pain worse.

item.text: What are the biggest barriers to achieving your activity goals? For example: I have a lot of stress from work which makes my pain worse.

Below is a link to a video produced by the American Chronic Pain Association about living with chronic pain. Weâ€™d like to suggest you watch the video to help you prepare for your upcoming visit. This video can help you prepare to ask questions that are important to you when you visit with your provider.

The website linked below provides some information from the U.S. Pain Foundation about the causes and diagnosis of pain in general, treatment options and self management and well-being when living with pain. This information can help you prepare to ask questions that are important to you when you visit with your provider.
